abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Public Administration Reform
            Development Policy Loan for Morocco, initiated in 2003, aims
            at: (a) improving government efficiency in the management of
            budget resources through greater transparency and
            accountability, and by introducing performance measurement;
            and (b) improving government efficiency in the management of
            human resources through the preparation of a new management
            system for staffing and remuneration with performance
            measurement, while streamlining current human resources
            management. There are four components to the project. The
            first component is the greater visibility of policies and
            their medium-term budgetary implications by placing
            budgetary allocation decisions in a multiyear framework. The
            objective of this component is to design and implement an
            aggregate Medium-Tern Expenditure Framework (MTEF). The MTEF
            is expected to set multiyear sector budget ceilings, while
            taking into account sector MTEFs derived from explicit
            intra- and inter sector priorities. Thus, these ceilings are
            consistent with the Medium Term Fiscal Framework ( MTFF),
            helping to ensure a more predictable and transparent fiscal
            policy. The second component is to improve efficiency in
            Human Resource Management (HRM). The objectives of the
            program are to modernize the current civil service by
            putting competences and performance at the core of the new
            system while keeping a career system. It also creates modern
            HRM tools to adapt civil service to key public sector
            missions and to manage staff in a more efficient manner. The
            new remuneration system, together with the mainstreaming of
            the Strategic Staffing Frameworks (RECs), will be a key
            achievement in the overall Human Resource (HR) reform
            program. The third component is to consolidate and control
            public payroll decrease. The key challenge in this component
            remains the high, albeit decreasing, share of the wage bill
            with respect to the country's income. Finally, the
            fourth component is the e-government and simplification of
            procedures. This new subprogram promotes the development of
            e-government as a key complementary tool for Morocco's
            public administration reforms. It focuses on e-government to
            simplify procedures and thus improve the efficiency,
            effectiveness, transparency, and accountability of the
            administrations. In addition, it uses e-government as an
            enabler of changes in behaviors, processes, and organization
            to transform these public entities.
